title: Ticket #6574: TestSubmit in condor.pm sometimes get truncated submit output
description:
Tests sometimes fail because the TestSubmit function in the Condor.pm module gets back a truncated stdout/stderr from a successful condor_submit. It then thinks that the submit failed because it can't parse the cluster id out of the result.

You end up with an error message in your test output that looks something like this. 

     error: couldn't find cluster id in condor_submit output:   at /slots/01/dir_131567/userdir/condor_tests/Condor.pm line 350. Why is cluster 0 in RunTest?????? Error: cmr_monitor_basic: CondorTest::RunTest(cmr-monitor-basic.cmd) failed

The problem appears to be that this line of code doesn't always work the way you would expect. 

Condor.pm line 324
   # submit the file
    runCommand( "$CONDOR_SUBMIT $debug_arg $cmd_file > $cmd_file.out 2>&1" )
	|| return 0;

This should be changed to use a more robust mechanism, preferably one with a timeout, and using the -terse output of condor_submit since that is designed to be parsable.
